page.title: 13Radio and Television.
page.content: The most popular{entertainment}in Mowsley and Laughton, especially with the childrem, is {television.}Those who were asked about their viewing said they were allowed to watch what they liked. About half said they were sometimes frightened by things they had seen.The most popular programmes are American gangster series such as "Knight-Rider","A-Team",and "Street Hawk".The magazine programme,"Blue Peter"is also popular. The comedy series watched include"The Young Ones" "Kenny Everett",and"Lenny Henry". The{radio}is not heard by many children except for pop music.Their parents listen more,especially to news programmes,plays and "The Archers". Television and,more frequently,radio are used for school broadcasts;radio being taped for convenience.Quite a few families own{video recorders.}
